result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank J. Beno Jr. was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess GHB,GB,BDO, Ketamine, Flunitraz. [Modifiers: Possession of a Controlled Substance on or near Certain Places, Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(f).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with current extended supervision he is now serving.

miscConds.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered for the balance due, and/or other collection means, such as income assignment will be issued.  The Defendant is to complete AODA assessment, if Agent deems it necessary, and comply with any treatment recommended.  The Defendant is to undergo any counseling the agent finds appropriate and must comply with any recommended treatment/assessment/counseling.  Defendant may not withdraw from any ordered program without permission of the agent and/or provider.  The Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - no use or possession of alcohol or drugs unless prescribed by a physician.  Defendant is to take prescribed medication as prescribed.  The Defendant is to have no contact with known drug dealers or users.    The Defendant is to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis.  This is a Dean appointment case.  Attorney to submit bill within 30 days.  Defendant is to pay attorney fees as previously ordered.

timeConds.notes: To be completed within the first six months.
